turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Battle of Bosworth Field.
turn.1: What happened at the Battle of Bosworth Field?
turn.2: Although a king could raise personal militia from his lands, he could only muster a significantly large army through the support of his nobles.
turn.3: How did Richard get the support of his nobles?
turn.4: Richard, like his predecessors, had to win over these men by granting gifts and maintaining cordial relationships.
turn.5: Did the nobles ever turn against Richard?
turn.6: Powerful nobles could demand greater incentives to remain on the liege's side or else they might turn against him.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Three groups, each with its own agenda, stood on Bosworth Field: Richard III and his Yorkist army; his challenger, Henry Tudor, who championed the Lancastrian cause; and the fence-sitting Stanleys.
turn.9: What was the image of Richard III?
turn.10: Small and slender, Richard III did not have the robust physique associated with many of his Plantagenet predecessors.
turn.11: What did Richard do to project a strong image?
turn.12: However, he enjoyed very rough sports and activities that were considered manly.
